Package aima.core.robotics.datatypes

Interface IMclRangeReading<R extends IMclRangeReading<R,​V>,​V extends IMclVector>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - the class that is implementing this interface.
    V - a n-1-dimensional vector implementing IMclVector, where n is the dimensionality of the environment.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRangeReading
    public interface IMclRangeReading<R extends IMclRangeReading<R,​V>,​V extends IMclVector>
    This interface defines a data type for a range measurement. It has to contain an IMclVector by which the robot was rotated from its original facing direction to receive the measurement.
    In addition it describes a method for using a range sensor noise model on the measurement.
    Author:
    Arno von Borries, Jan Phillip Kretzschmar, Andreas Walscheid

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double calculateWeight​(R secondRange)
      The range sensor noise model.
      V getAngle()
      Returns the vector by which the robot was rotated for this range reading.

    • Method Detail

      • getAngle

        V getAngle()
        Returns the vector by which the robot was rotated for this range reading.
        Returns:
        the vector by which the robot was rotated for this range reading.

      • calculateWeight

        double calculateWeight​(R secondRange)
        The range sensor noise model. Calculates a weight between 0 and 1 that specifies how similar the given range readings is to this range reading.
        Parameters:
        secondRange - the second range to be weighted against.
        Returns:
        a weight between 0 and 1.
